This blade will serve as the foundational element that defines the overall shape and purpose of the object, setting the stage for the subsequent components that will enhance its usability and design.

2.description: Next, add the bolster at the base of the blade where it transitions into the handle, ensuring a sturdy connection that enhances both strength and balance of the knife. This component is crucial as it provides structural support, preventing any potential wear or damage at the junction and also offers a comfortable grip for the userâ€™s hand.

3.description: Finally, add the handle to the bottom of the bolster, ensuring a secure grip for the user while providing balance to the knife's overall structure. This handle not only completes the knife's ergonomic design but also enhances the functionality by allowing for precise control during use, linking seamlessly with both the blade and bolster for a cohesive tool.
